alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee; Racine (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:05PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Milwaukee and northeastern Racine Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 405 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sturtevant, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Racine, Oak Creek, Mount Pleasant, South Milwaukee, Sturtevant, Wind Point, Caledonia, Elmwood Park, North Bay, and Franksville. This includes Interstate 41/94 between mile markers 328 and 337. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
